column4: if i'd like to use the external harddrive im going to buy in both windows or linux, which filesystem should i use, fat32 or ext* (ie. does fat have a better implementation on linux or ext* a better implementation on windows) ?
if you're going ot be hooking that up with other Windoze boxes, that don't have a special driver to work with ext3, then FAT32 is probably your best bet
just with my own, i can install any drivers i'd like
well then go ext3. much better file system
